newsitem.title: FRANCE: Saint-Gobain to cut stakes in other firms.
newsitem.headline: Saint-Gobain to cut stakes in other firms.

text.p: French building materials group Saint-Gobain will reduce stakes held in other companies in which it has been a member of a group of core shareholders, chairman Jean-Louis Beffa said on Tuesday.
He said this would happen this year.
Saint-Gobain has stakes in companies including Cie Generale des Eaux, Banque Nationale de Paris and Cie de Suez.
Beffa added the Generale stake was a "strategic holding".
"Saint-Gobain is a company which will develop through profitability", he said.
Its stakes would be considered as financial investments.
He said there had been a strong rise in the value of shares between January 1996 and March 1997.
He said that Saint-Gobain's own core shareholder group in the past had supported the company in "vulnerable years" including its acquisition of the U.S. Norton group.
